moves.1. e3 d5 2. c4 e6 3. cxd5 Nf6 4. Nc3 Bb4: making Nc3 weak, right from the start...
Black lost two pawns: but White is undeveloped...
moves.11. Nf3 Nf6 12. O-O c5: always the gambit pawn c5: Black is searching for ways, to develop Ra8...
moves.16. Qh5 g6 17. Qh6 Ng5 18. Nxg5 Qe7: a little trick: Black gives a piece - after all is said and done, a pawn - for drawing tempo...
moves.19. Nh3 Qg7 20. Qf4 Be6: we need to take out Nh3: after that, Whites' mating chances have diminished...
moves.23. f4 Rfd8: trying to force Qxc5, Rac8, with winning prospects...
moves.24. Qc6 Rac8 25. Qg2 c4: on we go: we need to dissolve Whites' Queens' wing...
moves.26. h4 Qd5: Qxg2, Kxg2, Rd2+, is winning for Black...
moves.30. Kh1 Re8: Rc8 was under attack: order restored...
moves.31. Rae1 Qh3: guarantees at least a draw: y'all work it out for yourselves...
moves.32. Rxe8+ Kf7: attacking two pieces in one blow...
moves.33. Qe2 Kxf6: White is losing control: and he's getting behind in time...
moves.36. Qg5+ Kg7: in this position, White timed out: in an of course superior position; but he has only eternal check...
